Interface ExecutionEnvironment

All Known Implementing Classes:
EagerSession, Graph
public interface ExecutionEnvironment
Defines an environment for creating and executing TensorFlow Operations.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    ExecutionEnvironment.Types

  • Method Details

    • opBuilder

      OperationBuilder opBuilder(String type, String name, Scope scope)
      Returns a builder to create a new Operation.
      Parameters:
      type - of the Operation (i.e., identifies the computation to be performed)
      name - to refer to the created Operation in this environment scope. Should already have been made unique.
      scope - the scope that owns the created op
      Returns:
      an OperationBuilder to create an Operation when OperationBuilder.build() is invoked. If OperationBuilder.build() is not invoked, then some resources may leak.

    • attachFunction

      void attachFunction(ConcreteFunction function)
      Attach the function and its dependencies to this execution environment, allowing it to be called.

      Done automatically in the Ops.call(ConcreteFunction, java.util.Map) ops.

    • isOpEnabled

      default boolean isOpEnabled(String opType)
      Returns true if the given operation is valid in this execution environment.
      Parameters:
      opType - The op to check.
      Returns:
      Whether the given operation is valid in this execution environment.

    • checkInput

      default void checkInput(Op input)
      Checks that input is valid to use as an input in this execution environment. Throws IllegalArgumentException if not.
      Parameters:
      input - The op to check
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if input can't be used as an input in this execution environment.

    • checkInput

      void checkInput(Operation input)
      Checks that input is valid to use as an input in this execution environment. Throws IllegalArgumentException if not.
      Parameters:
      input - The op to check
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if input can't be used as an input in this execution environment.

    • environmentType

      ExecutionEnvironment.Types environmentType()
      Get the type of this environment (from the `Environments` enumeration.
      Returns:
      An `Environments` value indicating the type of execution environment.

    • isEager

      default boolean isEager()

    • isGraph

      default boolean isGraph()

    • baseScope

      Scope baseScope()
      Get the top level scope for this execution environment. Is cached, which is necessary to prevent name collisions.

    • isInitializer

      boolean isInitializer(Operation op)
      Get whether an op is an initialization op.

      Should generally only be used internally.
